title: AT&T Grants NSA Direct Access to Internet Backbone Infrastructure
description: AT&T provides NSA with unprecedented direct access to its internet backbone infrastructure through secret facility installations at major network switching centers. This establishes the foundation for mass surveillance programs by routing duplicate internet traffic streams directly to NSA analysis facilities.
significance: Establishes the corporate-government surveillance partnership that bypasses traditional warrant requirements and constitutional protections, creating the infrastructure for systematic mass surveillance.

summary: In September 2001, AT&T established a secret partnership with the NSA to provide direct access to its internet backbone infrastructure, creating unprecedented mass surveillance capabilities that bypass traditional legal protections. This infrastructure enabled the systematic collection and analysis of millions of Americans' communications without warrants. Documents reveal AT&T's 'extreme willingness to help' the NSA, sharing billions of phone and email records across domestic networks.
